desc: You shall create a stillframe render of an exterior scene. It could be just an exterior environment, like an alley. Or it could be a product that happens to be shown in an exterior scene - like a bike, shoe or car. As part of this assignment you shall capture and gather a minimum of 50 reference images/videos of your item. Model your object based off of your references as accurate as possible. Your mesh type shall be of the type polygon. Create photo realistic materials by using procedural textures and maps where appropriate. Set up a lighting scenario to promote your item as a selling packshot or product visualization or lifestyle image. Present your current progress each and every day by using your dailies folder inside of your project. Keep in mind that we are looking for a realistic end result.1.3 PreparationThink of what kind of final image you would like to produce. What kind of feeling do you want your image to produce? Camera angles, moods and format plays a big part of this. Decide upon your item and then do the proper research, how is it used, built, coated, painted and such? Get to know everything about what you are trying to re-create. See the item/scene in person, go somewhere or to someone who might have it and ask to check it out. Bring your finest camera and take photos of everything.Folder structure:For this assignment you shall be using the default built in project system of Maya and it's default project structure. With the exception of adding a dailies and a references folder. Create a project in Maya, and create 2 custom folders named "dailies" and "references". When you are booting up a new session of Maya you will have to use the function 'set project' to sync your paths. This is very important to keep relative file paths. It is quite common for projects to get big so please clean out any and all unused files and versions. Aim to submit a project with the maximum size of 200mb. Make a .zip of your entire project and name it [url removed, login to view]". Where N is the number of your group. Make sure to remove "excessive" files, images, references and what not. We only want to save what is connected to your final maya [url removed, login to view] file:We don't need all different file versions for submission, leave only one file in the scenes folder named [url removed, login to view]'. Where N is your group number. Keep in mind that the output should be of ascii file format(.ma) and not binary(.mb). It is expected of you to have a nice and organized scene with everything named properly.Dailies:All of your dailies must be supplied in your projects dailies-folder. At the end of each day you simply take a few snapshots, playblasts and such and place it in a folder with todays date. NOTE that the dailies need to show in the filename WHO made them.exteriordailies2016-09-182016-09-192016-09-202016-09-21 and so on...You need at least one still image each and every day.Name your daily files to what they represent. Example: "[url removed, login to view]" or "[url removed, login to view]". Also make sure to put names or initials so it's easy to distinguish who's working on what.We expect it to be one folder for each working day.References:As you need a minimum of 50 references you will have to supply these aswell, these should all be placed inside of your 'references' folder. For extra credit, present them as collages as for example an A4-page with several images, it could have one page for shapereferences, one for material references etc.OutputFormat: EXRResolution: 1920x1080.Name: [url removed, login to view] (where N is your group-number)1.5 EquipmentSchools computers with Maya, Photoshop, Nuke and VRay
title: exterior scene

desc: I need a animated head of a girl child.1) I will provide you a face pic of a 10 year old boy.2) You need to create a similar looking 3D complete neck to head and face of it.3) This head portion should be designed in such a way that the boy who is from point number 1 above can walk and sit in all portions and the head should fit his body in all the positions whats so ever. Imagine the boy is sitting on a chair but suddenly starts running, turning round and round, No compromise on this point will be entertained.Question 1) What is the purpose of this head?Answer - This is going to be used for a youtube web series where this 10 year old boy is the actual actor and he wants a supporting actor who is going to be his own 3D character but only with the head in animation rest body will be his.Question 2) Why are we not going with a complete body animated copy of this boy?Answer - Its because there are two characters as I said above the first one is the actual boy and the other is the 3D head of the same boy with his body body. The actual speaking is going to be done by the 3D head character and the actual boy is never going to speak anything. We are going to launch this web series in multiple languages and therefore to enact in all those multiple language for anybody is impossible therefore we have chose to use the 3D head to do that so that a 3D animator can easily lip sync the same series in multiple languages by tweaking the 3D head lips. This will remove all the load off the actual boys part and we will be able to successfully launch the channel in all the languages at a fast rate.
title: 3D Animation

desc: You shall rig your personal, or from a pick of the teachers static objects to a fully deformable rig. Everything must be set up as if it were a professional production where we create the rigs blueprint or rigDesign prior to starting the actual rigging process. With this assignment comes the basic need of naming conventions and standards that must be followed precicely throughout for a predictable output. Each student is to follow a very strict pipeline set prior. If a student chooses to work outside the set pipeline that student simply tells us that he or she won’t be fit in a production and will therefor not pass the assignment. Please find the pipeline/name convention information under [url removed, login to view] this is a highly technical assignment everything has to be scriptable and pipeline friendly, therefor naming will be a big part of this assignment. Even a small spelling error might cost you a grade. All of this will however be controlled throughout a set of tech checks. Simply follow the guidelines and you will be just fine. Be observant! The key do success here is to review, review and review.In short, your job is to create a production ready rig that follows a specific studio [url removed, login to view] DesignAmount: Minimum 2Format: .pngResolution: 1920*1080Name Convention: [url removed, login to view]*Video ReferencesAmount: Minimum 25Format: -Resolution: -Name Convention: Name file to what it representsStill ReferencesAmount: Minimum 50Format: -Resolution: -Name Convention: Name file to what it representsRigFormat: .maNamnkonvention: [url removed, login to view]**Replace creatureName with the actual name of your creature, still following name convention document. If type, replace that with what it might show, IE body, face, foot etc1.5 EquipmentAutodesk MayaCamera for photo/video referenceTablet (Not required but recommended)
title: rigging modeling

desc: A little about the Startup:At the moment it's an idea of the Startup of the cartoon with great potential! Because we will do our best in its promotion!After drawing characters, preparing for the presentation and solving all issues, the Startup will be presented in all studios in Russia and the United States. Active promotion and contract conclusion with the studio is planned for 2018.I suggest you take part in the Startup with me on the terms of a written agreement. At the beginning, there is no budget, so payment will be based on the result (first profit). But I guarantee the payment of labor, everything will be legally certified if necessary. Perhaps we will go together to present the idea in the US (paying expenses are on me). Also it is possible to create IOS,Android game applications before contract conclusion with a cartoon studio.If you do not want to take part in the Startup, but you want to get a fixed amount for drawing the characters, then we will also be able to agree.And now more about the work itself:There are sketches of 8 characters. The task of the project includes:- Detailed drawing of 2D characters- Creation of minimal animation for these characters (characteristic for each one, for example "chuckle", "embarrassment", "madness", etc.)- Experience is welcome, but not required. The main thing is computer animation skills, great desire and enthusiasm!Additionally it is possible:- Participate as a partner or just to be a part of the team in the launch of the Startup of animated cartoon and IOS,Android game applications.
title: Animator for computer animation of the cartoon characters

desc: Hi,I have a set of aerial images of a building that I would like to turn into a 3D model using the following methods:1. Initial Processing: Point Cloud Generation (via Photogrammetric methods)2. Post-Processing: 3D Modelling (for aesthetics)These were acquired in a single straight overhead flight over the building (target of interest), which is what I would like to recreate. The images were then deliberately resampled to a coarser resolution. I will provide the dataset.Due to how the images were captured, however, one side of this building is lacking in image coverage. Hence, points cannot be derived and post-processing of the resultant point cloud will, therefore, be necessary to construct a clean, good-looking model on all 4 sides of the building - aesthetic appearance is important in this project.The deliverables are:1. Video fly-through of the final product2. Point cloud files in .las formatMany thanks.Best regards,Xu
title: Point Cloud & 3D Model Generation from Low-Res Aerial Photos - Repost - open to bidding
